lead_paragraph: The message came after the cartel decide to maintain high levels of production, citing the recent rise in prices and signs that the global petroleum glut might be easing.

byline.contributor: Ben Hubbard contributed reporting from Riyadh, Saudi Arabia.

headline.print_headline: Modernizing Saudi Minister Keeps OPEC’s Oil Flowing
headline.main: Saudi Oil Chief Khalid al-Falih Tells OPEC Changes Are Coming

snippet: The message came after the cartel decide to maintain high levels of production, citing the recent rise in prices and signs that the global petroleum glut might be easing.
abstract: Saudi Arabia's new oil minister Khalid al-Falih is moving to keep nation's oil production high and invest money in other industries to bolster economy; one of his goals is prod OPEC into changing its mindset of taking on worldwide management of oil supplies and prices, and to invest in other industries that can bring revenue to Saudi Arabia.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries
